alert.note: Alert for Cayuga; Cortland; Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Cayuga, Cortland and Onondaga. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Numerous reports of flooded basements have been reported further west from this cluster of showers and thunderstorms. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Syracuse, Pompey, Manlius, Owasco, Otisco, Skaneateles, Liverpool, Locke, Genoa, Marcellus, Preble, Moravia, Camillus, Niles, Scott, Sempronius, Tully, Lyndon, Kelloggsville and La Fayette. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
